js:knimeNode.name: Bubble Chart (Plotly)
js:knimeNode.shortDescription: A bubble chart based on the Plotly.js library.

intro.n:p: A bubble chart based on the Plotly.js library. This chart is used to display three dimensions or features (one along the X-Axis, one along the Y-Axis, and a third displayed as the relative size of the 'bubbles' in the plot). It is similar to a scatter plot in use and functionality. This plot requires three numeric columns and an optional nominal/categorical column for further filtering options.

The node supports custom CSS styling. You can simply put CSS rules into a single string and set it as a flow variable 'customCSS' in the node configuration dialog. Current KNIME classes are NOT YET supported, so class names will have to be deduced from the view itself. We are hoping to support standard KNIME classes in an upcoming update.

Please note: the Plotly.js KNIME extension is currently in Beta. It is recommended that you handle missing values and normalize your data before using visualization nodes in this extension until a more stable version is released. Please feel free to leave feedback and suggestions on our community forum here .

options.columnSelectorOption: Select the column to be initially displayed along the Y-Axis.
Select the column to be used for calculated relative sizes.

If a previous cluster/binning operation has been performed, selected the column containing each rows membership for a more dynamic interactive experience. These nominal groups will be used to categorize the data as it's displayed and allow you to hide/show various groups by clicking/double-clicking on the group in the legend.
options.checkBoxOption: When enabled this will display a warning whenever there is a missing value present in the data and give a count on how many missing values exist in the data.

radioButtonOption.name: Missing values handling
radioButtonOption.possibleValues: Skip rows with missing values Leave missing values
radioButtonOption.label: Missing values

options.radioButtonOption: The way in which this view tries to compensate for missing or invalid values. "Skip rows with missing values" will omit the entire row if a single cell is missing. This can affect multiple traces on the chart in some circumstances. "Leave missing" will leave a gap where the missing value exists and draw the chart anyways.

tab.name: General Plot Options
tab.description: These options control the initial state of the view.

options.stringOption: The label for the X-Axis. If left blank, the current X-Axis feature name will be used.
The label for the Y-Axis. If left blank, the current Y-Axis feature name will be used.
options.checkBoxOption: When checked, the chart's legend is displayed.
When checked, a grid is displayed on the chart.

When checked, the colors provided by the data table will be ignored and the color chosen below for "Data color" will be applied to the plot. If there are no colors provided with the data, the node will use the "Data color" by default, even if this option has not been selected.
options.colorOption: The color of the data on the plot if there are no colors provided with the table (i.e. from the "Color Manager" node) or if "Override colors" has been chosen. This color will not be automatically applied if the data has "Default" colors, it will only be automatically applied if in the absence of ANY colors. You can always apply this color to the data by selecting the "Override colors" option.
The background color of the plot, including the axes labels, the title and the subtitle.
The background color of the data area, within the axes.

tab.name: Control Options
tab.description: Use these options to configure the available controls within the view.

options.checkBoxOption: Check to enable controls in the chart.
When checked, a fullscreen option is displayed in the KNIME interactive menu.
Check to enable toggling of the tooltip within the view.
Check to enable drop down menu's allowing you to switch the features displayed on the axes.
Check to enable the editing of the title and axis labels within the view.
Check to enable toggling of selection-only within view.
Check to enable toggling of selection publishing within view.
Check to enable toggling of selection subscription within view.
Check to enable toggling of filter subscription within view.
Check to enable toggling of filter subscription within view.

tab.name: Interactivity
tab.description: This KNIME implementation of Plotly is compatible with the other interactive JavaScript views in the KNIME analytics platform. Use these options to control the degree to which this chart interacts with other views.

options.checkBoxOption: If checked a separate column containing checkboxes is rendered in the view.
Displays a button to clear current selection.
If checked, the view reacts on notifications from other interactive views that the selection has been changed. See also "Publish selection events".
If checked, notifies other interactive views when user changes the selection in the current view. See also "Subscribe to selection events".
If checked, the view reacts on notifications from other interactive views that a filter has been created or modified.
